2102.verse: وَإِن|And indeed,|98|107|213$كَادُواْ|they were about (to)|161|178|694$لَيَفْتِنُونَكَ|tempt you away|128|145|10469$عَنِ|from|54|71|1663$ٱلَّذِىٓ|that which|91|108|138$أَوْحَيْنَآ|We revealed,|107|116|4640$إِلَيْكَ|to you|63|95|45$لِتَفْتَرِىَ|that you invent|123|188|10470$عَلَيْنَا|about Us|79|144|681$غَيْرَهُۥ‌ۖ|other (than) it.|121|186|2025$وَإِذًا|And then|80|112|4156$لَّٱتَّخَذُوكَ|surely they would take you|200|384|10471$خَلِيلاً|(as) a friend.|107|291|4494$

2096.verse: And when adversity touches you at sea, lost are [all] those you invoke except for Him. But when He delivers you to the land, you turn away [from Him]. And ever is man ungrateful.

2097.verse: Then do you feel secure that [instead] He will not cause a part of the land to swallow you or send against you a storm of stones? Then you would not find for yourselves an advocate.

2098.verse: Or do you feel secure that He will not send you back into the sea another time and send upon you a hurricane of wind and drown you for what you denied? Then you would not find for yourselves against Us an avenger.

2099.verse: And We have certainly honored the children of Adam and carried them on the land and sea and provided for them of the good things and preferred them over much of what We have created, with [definite] preference.

2100.verse: [Mention, O Muhammad], the Day We will call forth every people with their record [of deeds]. Then whoever is given his record in his right hand - those will read their records, and injustice will not be done to them, [even] as much as a thread [inside the date seed].

2101.verse: And whoever is blind in this [life] will be blind in the Hereafter and more astray in way.

2102.verse: And indeed, they were about to tempt you away from that which We revealed to you in order to [make] you invent about Us something else; and then they would have taken you as a friend.

2103.verse: And if We had not strengthened you, you would have almost inclined to them a little.

2104.verse: Then [if you had], We would have made you taste double [punishment in] life and double [after] death. Then you would not find for yourself against Us a helper.
